en.pageTitle: Paintbrush Emojis 🖌️🎨 Copy and Paste - LaughingEmoji.net
en.metaDescription: Copy and paste a wide variety of art and writing emojis 🖌️🎨🖍️✏️✒️🖋️. One-click copy for all your creative expressions!
en.paintbrushOgTitle: Paintbrush Emojis 🖌️🎨 Copy and Paste - LaughingEmoji.net
en.paintbrushOgDescription: The ultimate collection of art and writing emojis! Copy and paste 🖌️, 🎨, 🖍️, ✏️, and more artistic emojis with one click.
en.clickToCopy: Click any emoji to copy to clipboard!
en.paintbrushExploreDescription: Explore and copy a diverse collection of emojis related to art, painting, and writing for your messages and social media.
en.paintbrushMeaningContent: The collection of art and writing emojis, including 🖌️ (Paintbrush), 🎨 (Artist Palette), and 🖍️ (Crayon), represents creativity, artistic expression, and the act of creating. They are commonly used to convey messages about painting, drawing, and design. Other emojis like ✏️ (Pencil) and 🖋️ (Fountain Pen) are used for writing, note-taking, or formal communication. Collectively, these emojis symbolize the tools of creation and communication.
en.paintbrushUsageContent: These emojis are widely used in contexts related to art projects, school work, and creative hobbies. The 🖌️ emoji is used when talking about painting or fine arts. The 🎨 emoji often accompanies discussions about color, design, or artistic styles. The ✏️ and 🖋️ emojis are perfect for emphasizing writing tasks, such as 'I'll make a note of that ✍️' or 'Let's finalize the agenda ✏️'. They are also used metaphorically to represent the act of creation or a creative process in a digital context.
en.paintbrushHistoryContent: The concept of using pictorial characters to convey ideas is ancient, but modern emojis have roots in Japanese mobile communication. Many of the early art and writing emojis, such as the 🖌️ (Paintbrush), were introduced as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and later in Emoji 1.0 in 2015. The idea of using a paintbrush icon for digital tools dates back even further to the work of graphic designer Susan Kare for the first Apple Macintosh computer's "MacPaint" application.
en.paintbrushStoryContent: Many original Macintosh icons, including the paintbrush for the "MacPaint" program, were created by designer Susan Kare, whose work helped define the modern graphical user interface. A fun fact is that the word "emoji" comes from the Japanese words "e" (picture) and "moji" (character), and is not related to the English word "emotion". Interestingly, some modern artists have embraced these digital symbols, using emojis as a "painting palette" to create impressive works of art on their phones.
en.footerDescription: Your ultimate resource for a wide range of art and writing emojis. Discover, copy, and share the perfect emoticon for any creative or literary occasion.

zh.pageTitle: 画笔 Emoji 🖌️🎨 复制粘贴 - LaughingEmoji.net
zh.metaDescription: 复制和粘贴各种艺术和书写表情符号 🖌️🎨🖍️✏️✒️🖋️。一键复制，满足您的所有创意表达！
zh.paintbrushOgTitle: 画笔 Emoji 🖌️🎨 复制粘贴 - LaughingEmoji.net
zh.paintbrushOgDescription: 艺术与书写表情符号的终极集合！一键复制和粘贴 🖌️、🎨、🖍️、✏️ 和更多艺术表情符号。
zh.mainTitle: 画笔 Emoji 🖌️🎨 复制粘贴 🖍️✏️
zh.clickToCopy: 点击任何表情符号即可复制到剪贴板！
zh.paintbrushExploreDescription: 探索和复制用于您的消息和社交媒体的各种与艺术、绘画和书写相关的表情符号。
zh.paintbrushMeaningContent: 这组艺术与书写表情符号，包括 🖌️ (画笔)、🎨 (调色板) 和 🖍️ (蜡笔)，代表着创意、艺术表达和创作行为。它们通常用于传达与绘画、素描和设计相关的信息。其他表情符号如 ✏️ (铅笔) 和 🖋️ (钢笔) 则用于书写、笔记或正式交流。总的来说，这些 emoji 象征着创作和沟通的工具。
zh.paintbrushUsageTitle: 画笔 Emoji 的使用场景
zh.paintbrushUsageContent: 这些表情符号广泛用于与艺术项目、学业和创意爱好相关的语境中。🖌️ emoji 用于谈论绘画或美术。🎨 emoji 经常伴随关于色彩、设计或艺术风格的讨论。✏️ 和 🖋️ emoji 非常适合强调书写任务，例如“我会记下那个 ✍️”或“让我们敲定议程 ✏️”。它们也常被用作在数字环境中代表创作行为或创意过程的比喻。
zh.paintbrushHistoryTitle: 画笔 Emoji 的发展历史
zh.paintbrushHistoryContent: 使用象形字符来传达想法的概念由来已久，但现代 emoji 的根源来自日本的移动通信。许多早期的艺术与书写 emoji，例如 🖌️ (画笔)，于 2014 年作为 Unicode 7.0 的一部分被引入，并随后在 2015 年加入 Emoji 1.0。将画笔图标用于数字工具的想法甚至可以追溯到更早，即平面设计师 Susan Kare 为第一台 Apple Macintosh 电脑的“MacPaint”应用程序所做的开创性工作。
zh.paintbrushStoryTitle: 画笔 Emoji 的有趣故事
zh.paintbrushStoryContent: 许多原始 Macintosh 的图标，包括用于“MacPaint”程序的画笔，都是由设计师 Susan Kare 创作的，她的作品帮助定义了现代图形用户界面。一个有趣的事实是，“emoji”一词来源于日语的“e”（絵，意为图片）和“moji”（文字，意为字符），与英语单词“emotion”无关。有趣的是，一些现代艺术家已经接纳了这些数字符号，并使用 emoji 作为“调色板”在他们的手机上创作出令人印象深刻的艺术作品。
zh.footerDescription: 您获取各种艺术和书写表情符号的终极资源。发现、复制并分享适合任何创意或文学场合的完美表情符号。
